post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
I plugged in my old C64 last night and gave The Blues Brothers a whirl. Man I love that soundtrack. There's some really classic sound from those games....ROBOCOP!!!
I can't believe it, I found a vid of it on youtube!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dO--HMCSCkU

post.author: Ivan_the_B
post.body:
Duke Nukem
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g-y0MdPXslo

post.author: Jack Rammsdell
post.body: twisted metal 2/3/4 for playstation, quake and quake 2 for pc I'm sure there is some newer games, with music I like but as far as I can remember, these are a games that doubled as sound tracks, the cd could be put in a cd player and the sound track would play.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Turrican 2 (Chris Hülsbeck):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4rvQzQL6kSo
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aooHpUe5e3A

Alot of other stuff from Hülsbeck on C64 and Amiga... Chris Hülsbeck has released several highly acclaimed CD compilations of his game soundtracks.

Ambermoon (Amiga RPG) by Matthias Steinwachs

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body: gotta say, the space quest theme song is one that sticks in my mind ALL THE TIME.

post.author: Deadite4
post.body:
Killer Instinct was always a favorite of mine. I remember when I bought the SNES version it even came with all the music on a CD.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=avPSzGVCPH0

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Deadite4 wrote:
Killer Instinct was always a favorite of mine. I remember when I bought the SNES version it even came with all the music on a CD.

Lol, me too, but don't try to relisten to this soundtrack as i did last year, it's horrible! "she's a killer!"

There are many games OST that i love to listen, cause to be honest, i rarelly listen other musics than games OST.

My best "past" OST is certainly Starcraft, cause it make me feel nostalgic
And for actual games: "The Witcher - Musics from the game" (not the Audio CD inspired from the game)

post.author: Hostyle
post.body: RTCW, Crysis, AC, Prey, The Movies, but only some tracks.

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
Sonic was played for most of my teen years. The good times, the bad, the glorious end of zone fights. The "Get into bed!" from mamma. Starlight Zone is what I'm talkin about. I miss the Mega Drive.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3mqmN6mw4R8

post.author: Kristus
post.body:
From the top of my head

Syndicate (For PC and for PSX)
System Shock 1 and 2
Doom 1 and 2
Quake 1 and 2
Super Mario bros 1 - 3
Castlevania
Descent
Link of Zelda
C&C - Tiberian Dawn
C&C - Red Alert
Heretic
Hexen

post.body:

post.author: aaa111
post.body:
Doom 1&2
UT 99 & 04
Unreal 1
RTCW

post.author: Mordenkainen
post.body: I have loads of .mid from game soundtracks and until a few months ago the only online radio I listened to was gamingfm.com. Sadly they went kaputt (thanks BNA!) so I'm back to local music files. It's hard to pick a favourite and (like music in general) depends on my mood and what I'm doing. Planescape: Torment music is great for relaxing. I often map listening to either Diablo II or Halo. Castlevania (especially IV's) and Ultima's are beatiful. UT Classic has some great music, DOOM, heck, there's really too many to just pick one.

post.author: Kristus
post.body:
iceheart wrote:
Cannon Fodder .

Hah, yeah. I know the title track of that game by heart.

"War! Never been so much fun.
War! Never been so much fun!

Go to your brother,
Kill him with your gun,
leave him lying in his uniform,
dying in the sun!"

post.author: kit89
post.body: One of my favourite soundtracks has to be the tracks from Crash Bandicoot 2: Wrath Of Cortex. The music in that was/is excellent.

post.author: Kristus
post.body:
Almost forgot one of the most important. American McGee's Alice. Love that soundtrack.
And the Myst soundtracks are all of epic quality. (Only lacks Myst 3 and 4 to have the complete set)

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
megdrux wrote:
Cette ligne de montre Breitling Bentley replica'a pas le regard approximatif et dur. Elle vient avec la beauté, la simplicité et l'élégance personnifiées. Yacht-Maître de Breitling : Festin spécial pour les marins professionnelsLe Yacht-Maître de Breitling a les caractéristiques de conception très spéciales, qui lui font l'meilleur ami pour les marins professionnels.


Indeed, I always loved listening to my watch tick and chime. Man this brings back memories

post.author: lowdragon
post.body:
My other post may made me sounded wrong - cause i does like "real" music better than the 8bit noises.
Vampire2 does have some nice licenced songs > ministry - bloodlines and few others.
Wouldnt mind to get tunes like from "System Of A Down" and "Disturbed" in games
( i dont link them since music-videos might get tracked by ) insteed of ambient stuff - however, fable got a catchy theme too.

PS: We had "Barracuda" in our local pub`s jukebox - like in every jukebox around the "world".

post.author: mavrik65
post.body:
1. tony hawks pro skater 2 - gorilla radio ( by rage against the machine ).

2. doom3 theme tune - I'm not just saying this because it's a doom3 website, i actually really liked the theme tune, god bless metal.

3. prince of Persia warrior within - i stand alone ( by god smack ).

4. prey - that tune was pretty epic.

5. mario kart wii - it's so great when you win and the victory music plays.

post.author: DoomUK
post.body:
There's too many to list, but I'd have to say Bioshock's soundtrack would be near the top of it.

The ambient stuff blended in with 30's/40's/50's tunes coming out of the phonographs and jukeboxes throughout the world. Creepy.

post.author: Wobbo
post.body:
All of the Sonic the Hedgehog side-scrollers were masterpieces, no videogame has got "urban" music right since.

Tyrian, Deus Ex, and most of Alexander Brandon's work.

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body:
Doom (PC)
Doom (psx)
Myst (PC)
Wipeout (psx)
Quake (PC)
Quake 3 (PC)
Zelda: Twilight Princess (Gamecube/Wii)
Zelda: The Wind Waker (Gamecube)
Knights of the Old Republic (PC)
Sanitarium (PC)
Duke3d (PC)
Shadow Warrior (PC)
RTCW (PC)
Resident Evil remake(Gamecube)

post.author: evilartist
post.body:
- Super Mario Bros. 3
- Legend of Zelda
- Halo
- Gears of War (some of it)
- Quake 4 (only that one track that plays during huge battles)
- Duke Nukem 3d Opening Theme
- Call of Duty
- Doom 3 Opening
- Metroid
- A bunch of other songs from Smash Bros. Brawl (should cover the rest of my Nintendo faves)
- Tales of Symphonia (only some, like Fighting of the Spirit and Last Battle-Decision)
- The chase music from Assassin's Creed (after you kill an important guy)
- Final Fantasy
- Chronicles of Riddick: Escape from Butcher Bay
- A bit of Painkiller
- Doom 1 & 2
- Heretic
- Hexen

There's probably more I forgot, but I'd say my top 3 are Zelda, Tales, and Halo.

EDIT: I would like to officially exclude Windwaker and Minish Cap from Legend of Zelda above. Their music sucks. Thanks for reminding me, CrimsonHead. ;P

post.author: smurkenstein
post.body:
Quake 1. Less music, more of a game enhancement. I vote it because it was more of a watershed, a transition point.

Around the time, I also enjoyed unreal - music by triggered event. Some impressive atmosphere.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Burrito wrote:
Outlaws
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=leX9GLac ... re=related

Thanks, I almost forgot about that one! That was a great game all in all... I still have the CD somewhere and the soundtrack was in audio tracks iirc. Time to dig this out!

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body:
I found some youtube videos of the PC game Sanitarium. I love the music in the mansion part when you are walking through the characters childhood home except it is all dilapidated now and full of ghosts of past memories the sad piano music accompanied with the game setting actually stirred my emotions, that is something that does'nt happen too often.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=03GFbFhI ... re=related

The Circus of Fools level music was pretty cool too.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHTyPKmT ... re=related

post.author: iceheart
post.body: Oh and, legend of kyrandia series, particularly the third one, awesome music .

post.author: Gunman
post.body:
Unreal 2 Music has one of the best electronic and orchestra music scores I ever got to hear so far.

Unreal 2: The Awakening - Intro

Various levels' music:
Sanctuary
Sulferon
Kalydon
Acheron
Hell (Yes, there is also a level called 'Hell' hehe ! )
Drakk Hive
Drakk Boss

Of course, there is a lot more than this. ^^

Because of this music (and other great things about this game such as variety of different places, level design, the sound effects, sound ambiance, graphics, visual effects etc, etc...), Unreal 2 will always be one of my all-time favorite games ever.

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I love the Half Life 2 Ep2 sound track!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uoCrkB4B ... re=related

ha, been listening it for months and been trying to play that song on my dad's guitar.

Of course the Doom3 sound track by Tweaker is good, I don't understand how they create good metal music, but they only make wired Alternative music that they sell.

quake (by NIN)
super metroid

planescape
